reviewTitle: Mivi Fort Q200 Excellent product at reasonable price
reviewDescription: I purchased Mivi Fort Q200 with 200 watts sound output at Rs. 4999/- from AmazonSize of Soundbar stick: approx 3 ft lengthWoofer dimensions:  Approx 9" front width x12" depth front to back x 18" heightBuild quality:Soundbar with metallic body and wooden woofer with good build quality.Bass : Excellent bass quality even at low volume also. Can be manually control by remote controlDisplay: it consist a small display on sound bar for visibility of mode and volume level as you can see in uploaded photoTreble: It is also upto mark can be controlled by remoteSurround sound effect: Excellent surround sound with full of cinematic experience if you have video input with original sound effect.Remote control: Infrared remote work properly not only from straight but support till several angles also.According to price range, 200 w this product is a most suitable and most recommended product of a Indian brandOverall a complete soundbar with value of money for less budget people who may not disappointed with product if you have technical knowledge about control and usage.

I did not know what a 48 watt speaker might feel untill i ordered this Made in INDIA MIVI FORT Q48 home theater speakers also it was priced within my budget..... IT IS AWESOME and it's design is simple and functional and its powerfull bass is just enough in my 10/20 feet hall aslo it is heard clearly in my whole house at full volume.... Thanks to the engineers at Mivi.... I say go for it !!!!!! it's worth every rupee. WOW :-)

reviewTitle: Exceptional Audio Upgrade - A Soundbar That Delivers Beyond Expectations!
reviewDescription: I recently purchased the Mivi Q120 soundbar, and I am beyond impressed with its performance. I having been using it for the past 10 days and I have to say this soundbar has truly transformed my home entertainment experience! Sound Quality: The sound quality is exceptional. The clarity, depth, and richness of the audio makes every movie, show, and song an immersive experience. The bass is powerful yet not overwhelming, and the dialogue clarity is impeccable, making it perfect for watching movies and TV shows.Design: The sleek and modern design of the soundbar seamlessly blends with my home decor. It‚Äôs not only a powerful audio device but also a stylish addition to my living room. The build quality feels premium and durable, indicating that it‚Äôs built to last.Ease of Setup: Setting up the soundbar was a breeze. The instructions were clear, and I had it up and running within minutes. The various connectivity options, including Bluetooth,HDMI ARC, AUX, Optical (they are providing Aux cable with the unit) makes it incredibly versatile and easy to use with different devices.Features: The soundbar comes with an array of impressive features. The sound effect is remarkable, creating a theater-like experience at home thanks to its 2.2 setup. The built-in Bluetooth allows me to stream music effortlessly from my phone, and the dedicated remote control makes it easy to adjust modes (news, music, movie) to my preference and also to different inputs like HDMI, Bluetooth, AUX and OpticalValue for Money: Considering the outstanding audio performance and the premium features, the Mivi Q120 soundbar is excellent value for money. It delivers a high-end audio experience without breaking the bank.In conclusion, the Mivi Q120 soundbar has exceeded my expectations in every way. If you‚Äôre looking to enhance your home audio experience without costing you a fortune then I highly recommend this soundbar. It‚Äôs a game-changer for anyone who values high-quality sound and sleek design!Just a small add on - If you are using it with Amazon Fire TV stick and you are not getting sound output with HDMI then go to Settings > Display & Sounds > Select Audio >Surround Sound> select PCM, selecting PCM will resolve the issue.

One of the best and quality sound sound bar. Meets expectations. Good bass. Tweeter quality ok..But needs improvement. I've customized by adding additional Tweeters. Movie mode gives good sound efffect. Best one for watching movie.

reviewTitle: Amazing Sound Quality and Value for Money
reviewDescription: I recently purchased the Mivi Fort Q200 Soundbar, and it has completely transformed my home entertainment experience. The 200W output delivers powerful, cinematic sound that fills the room with rich bass and crystal-clear highs. The 2.1 channel configuration with an external subwoofer ensures that every beat and dialogue is heard with perfect clarity.The multiple EQ modes are a fantastic feature, allowing me to switch between settings for movies, music, sports, and news with just a tap on the remote. The connectivity options are versatile, including Bluetooth v5.3, USB, AUX, Coaxial, and HDMI (ARC), making it easy to connect to various devices.The design is sleek and modern, with a high-end matte finish that looks great in any room. Overall, the Mivi Fort Q200 offers exceptional sound quality and versatility at an unbeatable price. Highly recommended for anyone looking to upgrade their home audio setup.

The sound is very irritating when USB is plugged in, there is no provision of changing the next or previous folder in usb mode .However in blutooth mode it works very well.Sound is good like D J.I love this unit.

Remote quality feel like a children toy, wall clamps are badly designed better to rest on a table. If you are looking for a 4k budget soundbar for better sound than tv, it is a wise choice. No dolby, dts- cannot expect in this price range.

I've tried mivi 60W and 80W soundbar but the sound quality of  MIVI 120W soundbar is exceptional, it has good bass, treble balanced and clear voice without distortion. It's more than enough for 150 sq. ft. room.

reviewTitle: Affordable Sound Upgrade: Mivi Q200 Soundbar
reviewDescription: The Mivi Q200 is a budget-friendly soundbar with a woofer designed for an immersive audio experience. It offers a sleek, compact design that fits well with my home entertainment setups.The soundbar delivers clear audio with a decent balance of mids and highs, while the integrated woofer enhances bass, making it suitable for movies, music, and gaming.While the sound quality is good for its price range, audiophiles might find the bass less powerful compared to more premium models.The Mivi Q200 is easy to set up and use, with Bluetooth connectivity allowing for wireless streaming from various devices (I normally use my phone and TV).It‚Äôs a great option for those seeking an affordable upgrade to their home audio system without compromising too much on performance.
THANKS

    ¬†I won't pretend to be an audio expert as this is my first 4K TV and soundbar that I bought. So... Here goes the review:The yay...+ The volume on this soundbar is amazing. It really rocks the room when I want it to rock.+ Bluetooth 5 enabled, hence I never needed an HDMI cable to connect it. I turn the TV and soundbar automatically gets connected once its paired up in the start.+ No latency on audio, and the clarity is amazing.+ The subwoofers do their job perfectly.+ I mounted it under the TV on screws and I gotta say... It adds a certain bit of premiumness to my setup with its built quality and looks.The nah...- Remote feels cheap and not at all sturdy.- The soundbar has no display indicator screen to check volume, connection or mode. Only a blue light to show if its connected to a device or not.- There's no way to silence its "Connected!" message when it connects to the TV everytime I switch on both of them and its loud. So keep that in mind.Final thoughts:Amazing product. I can't think of a reason why I would switch back to TV speakers after using this. Its just that cool!

reviewTitle: Excellent Sound Quality & Value for Money!
reviewDescription:
The media could not be loaded.
                
            
                
            
            
        
    
    








  
  
    ¬†I‚Äôm thrilled with the MIVI Q200 Speaker with an External subwoofer‚Äîit's a fantastic home theater system at an unbeatable price!Pros:Great Sound Quality: Clear, balanced audio that suits all types of content‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs movies, music, or news.Powerful Bass: The  External subwoofer delivers deep, punchy bass that elevates music and movie soundtracks.4 Sound Modes: Includes Music, Movies, News, and 3D modes. All modes are highly functional, with the Movie and Music modes being especially impressive.Multiple Ports: HDMI, USB, AUX, Coaxial, HDMI ARC, and Bluetooth v5.3‚Äîplenty of options for connectivity.Home Theater Experience: Paired with a projector, this speaker creates a mini home theater setup, perfect for movie nights.Made in India: Proud to support a local brand that delivers great quality.Value for Money: It‚Äôs worth every penny‚Äîgood wattage, sound quality, and versatility for the price.Cons:No Front Display: A small display would have been nice, but it‚Äôs not a dealbreaker.3D Mode: The 3D mode is not very useful; the other modes are great though.Final Thoughts: For anyone looking for a high-quality, affordable speaker system, the MIVI Q200 with an External subwoofer is a solid choice. Great sound, great features, and a great price‚Äîhighly recommended!

I purchase is for first time from MIVI, but received very good speaker. Don't need to worry about look and sound. all is good.

As a basic 2.1 soundbar, it does the job. However, there are several annoyances which make this hard to recommend.1. It forgets the active input mode after power loss. I have to switch modes each time. This is made worse by the fact that it doesn't have the ability to detect which input is even active, and switch to that.2. There's no display, so it's hard to understand what the current volume/treble/bass levels are.3. There doesn't seem to be a reset to defaults option. So if the audio params were messed up, you have to guess what the normal levels are.4. There's an audible whine/hum when using the analog input (3.5mm, using the supplied cable).5. When connected via HDMI ARC, the connection isn't recognized sometimes. Have to power cycle the soundbar. This one I'm not sure where the fault lies (TV is brand new Xiaomi X series 55").6. The user manual is unhelpful -- it doesn't even explain all the functionalities. What are "3D", "News" mode buttons on the remote? From the name and from experience having used other soundbar, I can guess. But that's not the point -- the manual should not presume anything.In conclusion, the various shortfalls add up to make this product unrecommendable. I suggest looking elsewhere.
Good sound quality and a good sound bar in given price range, worth buying

reviewTitle: Good Quality Sound Bar for the price range
reviewDescription: Good product. Sound quality is good. But base is more and dominating vocals in some movie scenes. No base control to reduce the volume. Why I preferred this product is it has co-axial cable input for my realme TV. Other soundbars are having optical input which my TV doesn't have. Another point is inbuilt subwoofers. I don't want to clutter my bedroom with number of speakers/sub woofer. With inbuilt sub woofers it is space saving and at the same time they achieved good base for listening with inbuilt sub woofers.

If anyone wants a soundbar without an extra subwoofer then this a good choice. It gives balanced treble & bass which is sufficient for immersive sound experience. But there is no indicator for volume. One has to listen to the volume and adjust it by guessing. Please make sure ARC is enabled in TV. Also if sound not coming please enable the PCM setting in TV. It has 3 sound modes - news, music, movie. On my testing, I found the movie mode to deliver optimal sound output with good bass. But one thing, the soundbar forgets the connectivity settings which was previously set. I found a solution. First turn ON the TV, wait for the homepage to load, then turn ON the soundbar. Then the soundbar will auto-detect the input and it will auto-connect. But you have to select the movie mode again. Bluetooth connectivity is good. But HDMI ARC connection will deliver the best sound output. I was using this soundbar with a normal HDMI cable but I went for Honeywell 2.1 HDMI cable as I don't want any bottlenecking. Overall, if anyone wants a balanced sound with balanced bass & treble then it's good, but if anyone is a strong bass lover then please go for soundbar with woofer options. Thank you.
